body:
if you want to loop from 1 to 99, then just use
`for i := 1; i < 100; i++ {}`.

It's not Go's style to add syntax sugars just to
reduce some typing.

PS: you can use
```
for i := range [99]struct{}{} {
		println(i+1)
}
```
to archive the same without introducing new
syntax. However, this style is not considered
idiomatic Go.
